lines.text: So you don't want the credit?
I don't take credit; I'm a cash kind of guy.
We're all heroes if you catch us at the right moment.
You sure we can pull this off?
John, you're sitting on a ledge about to jump to your doom. I'm about to go to prison. What exactly have we got to lose?
I think there's a hero in all of us.
You're a god damn saint, John. Pardon the vulgarity.

[Bernie drives through a rainstorm]
I know why it's raining. I coulda predicted it. It's raining because my fucking wipers are all fucked up. If my wipers were okay, the fucking sun would be shining, AT NIGHT.

You remember when I said how I was gonna explain about life, buddy? Well the thing about life is, it gets weird. People are always talking ya about truth. Everybody always knows what the truth is, like it was toilet paper or somethin', and they got a supply in the closet. But what you learn, as you get older, is there ain't no truth. All there is is bullshit, pardon my vulgarity here. Layers of it. One layer of bullshit on top of another. And what you do in life like when you get older is, you pick the layer of bullshit that you prefer and that's your bullshit, so to speak.

[crawling through the burning plane attempting to find a man]
Fletcher! Hey Fletcher! Where are you?
Sir, please help me!

[noticing this man caught in the seats]
Are you Fletcher?
No, my name is Smith.
Well fuck you! Where's Fletcher?
Your father is Bernie LaPlante. It's against his religion to stick his neck out.

[Talking to his son over the payphone]
There's things you have to do - which reminds me - you know this hero business? One of the things you learn as-as you grow - as you grow older is that life gets very complicated... weird, actually. It's, you know, like people aren't exactly like they seem... nuthin' is. Life gets un-un-un- unbelievable... Uh, it gets normal as you get older.
You gotta look out for God damn number one, pardon the vulgarity.
Have you ever heard more bullshit or drivel coming from somebody who is not even the president?
Prisons are for tough guys. Prisons are for guys who beat each other up, lift weights, fuck each other.

[the plane crashes and Bernie stares at it wide-eyed]
Please help us!
These are $100 dollar shoes!

[carrying Gail out of the burning plane]
Give me a hand here, lady, I'm not a goddamn bodybuilder!
Those guys been in yet?
You in business with those guys or what? Cause, you know, I wouldn't want a problem for the establishment.
No, you couldn't have a problem, Chick, 'cause I personally have got them all. I cornered the whole market.
Hey hombre, he don't even trust his mother. Why he gonna trust you?
Because I'm not his mother.
[first lines]
Mr. foreman, have you arrived at a verdict?
